content.description:
IMAGE 1: RAJABAI TOWER, MUMBAI, INDIA

Source: Wikimedia Foundation

IMAGE 2: ELIZABETH TOWER, LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: Pixabay

Geographers study cultural traits, ideas, and practices and their diffusion across space and in places. These traits, ideas, and practices can change through a variety of processes.
content.question:
A. Explain how land-use patterns contribute to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1.

B. Describe TWO ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.

C. Explain a limitation of using the images to understand how sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1 or Image 2.

D. Explain how the use of the English language relates to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India.

E. Explain the degree to which differences within a country’s cultural landscape can relate to the process of devolution.

frqParts.text:
A. Explain how land-use patterns contribute to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1.

B. Describe TWO ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.

C. Explain a limitation of using the images to understand how sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1 or Image 2.

D. Explain how the use of the English language relates to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India.

E. Explain the degree to which differences within a country’s cultural landscape can relate to the process of devolution.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe a relevant geographic concept, process, model, or theory in a specified context.
